abstract: While Borders stands to receive a financing lifeline from GE Capital, the chain also raises the possibility of a bankruptcy filing.
snippet: While Borders stands to receive a financing lifeline from GE Capital, the chain also raises the possibility of a bankruptcy filing.
lead_paragraph: Borders Group, the struggling bookseller, said on Thursday that it had received a commitment from GE Capital for $550 million in refinancing — so long as the company meets several requirements, including signing up agreements with publishers to convert delayed payments into loans.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Julie Bosman
